entry.RedBlue: It uses its whiskers to maintain its balance. It apparently slows down if they are cut off.
entry.Yellow: Its hind feet are webbed. They act as flippers, so it can swim in rivers and hunt for prey.
entry.Gold: Gnaws on anything with its tough fangs. It can even topple concrete buildings by gnawing on them.
entry.Silver: Its whiskers help it to maintain balance. Its fangs never stop growing, so it gnaws to pare them down.
entry.Crystal: The webs on its hind legs enable it to cross rivers. It searches wide areas for food.
entry.RubySapphire: RATICATE’s sturdy fangs grow steadily. To keep them ground down, it gnaws on rocks and logs. It may even chew on the walls of houses.
entry.FireRed: Its rear feet have three toes each. They are webbed, enabling it to swim across rivers.
entry.LeafGreen: It uses its whiskers to maintain its balance. It apparently slows down if they are cut off.
entry.Emerald: A RATICATE’s sturdy fangs grow steadily. To keep them ground down, it gnaws on rocks and logs. It may even chew on the walls of houses.
entry.DiamondPearlPlatinum: It whittles its constantly growing fangs by gnawing on hard things. It can chew apart cinder walls.
entry.HeartGold: Gnaws on anything with its tough fangs. It can even topple concrete buildings by gnawing on them.
entry.SoulSilver: Its whiskers help it to maintain balance. Its fangs never stop growing, so it gnaws to pare them down.
entry.BlackWhite: It whittles its constantly growing fangs by gnawing on hard things. It can chew apart cinder walls.
entry.Black 2White 2: With its long fangs, this surprisingly violent Pokémon can gnaw away even thick concrete with ease.
entry.X: It whittles its constantly growing fangs by gnawing on hard things. It can chew apart cinder walls.
entry.Y: The webs on its hind legs enable it to cross rivers. It searches wide areas for food.
entry.Omega RubyAlpha Sapphire: Raticate’s sturdy fangs grow steadily. To keep them ground down, it gnaws on rocks and logs. It may even chew on the walls of houses.
entry.Sun: Its hind feet are webbed, so it’s a strong swimmer. It can cross rivers and sometimes even oceans.
entry.Moon: Its disposition is far more violent than its looks would suggest. Don’t let your hand get too close to its face, as it could bite your hand clean off.

GoldSilver: Route 7, 9, 10, 26, 27, 38, 39, Burned Tower, Mt. Mortar, Tohjo Falls, Union Cave
HeartGoldSoulSilver: Route 7, 9, 10, 26, 27, 38, 39, 47, Burned Tower, Mt. Mortar, Tohjo Falls, Union Cave
SunMoon: Route 10, 11, 14, 15, 16, 17, Akala Outskirts, Tapu Village, Malie City, Poni Wilds, Ancient Poni Path, Poni Grove, Poni Plains, Poni Gauntlet
